R: @kennknowles
At Apache, the issue tracker to use is Jira, not github issue.
it doesn't contradict you may still allow issues board here, for some meaningful and healthy discussion
The risk is that issue from github are not taken in the release notes, not in the release target. And it's an Apache policy.
Rebased and addressed the comments.

R: @echauchot 

This makes the WindowFn and related code more resilient to the arbitrariness of ordering.

This does cause the two tests to succeed on the Dataflow Runner, where they had previously failed. The failure of the ValidatesRunner suite are due to unrelated failures.
LGTM. Thank you. I will merge it after tests.
R: @takidau @XuMingmin
R: @takidau @XuMingmin

Jenkins failure is unrelated and Python tests passed.

I also verified that textio.ReadAllFromText can be used to read 1M 1MB text files.
R: @aaltay

The jenkins error here is related to gearpump build error (nightlySnapshot error already seen):

```
[ERROR] COMPILATION ERROR : 
[INFO] -------------------------------------------------------------
[ERROR] /home/echauchot/projects/beam/runners/gearpump/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/gearpump/translators/CreateStreamingGearpumpView.java:[126,25] method createPrimitiveOutputInternal in class org.apache.beam.sdk.values.PCollection<T> cannot be applied to given types;
  required: org.apache.beam.sdk.Pipeline,org.apache.beam.sdk.values.WindowingStrategy<?,?>,org.apache.beam.sdk.values.PCollection.IsBounded,org.apache.beam.sdk.coders.Coder<T>
  found: org.apache.beam.sdk.Pipeline,org.apache.beam.sdk.values.WindowingStrategy<capture#1 of ?,capture#2 of ?>,org.apache.beam.sdk.values.PCollection.IsBounded
  reason: actual and formal argument lists differ in length

```
Elasticsearch build is now ok, PTAL
